BioModel.name: CM_PM12648679_MB10::Substrate_depletion_oscillator
BioModel.text: phosphorylation of the enzymatic protein (E), modulated by the responseelement (R)

This ModelBrick from the article, " Sniffers, buzzers, togglesand blinkers â€¦" describes a substrate-depletion oscillator. Species Xis converted into R in an autocatalytic process. At first, X is abundantand R is scarce. As R builds up, R production accelerates until there isan explosive conversion of the entire pool of X into R. Then theautocatalytic reaction shuts off for lack of substrate, X. R isdegraded, and X must build up again before another burst of R isproduced. This is essentially the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frogegg extracts.
species X.In the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frog egg extracts, R is thephosphorylated form of cyclin B-CDK1
signal strength. Rate of synthesis of species X
enzymatic protein.In the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frog egg extracts, E is theunphosphorylated form of the phosphatase Cdc25
phosphorylated form of E, an enzymatic protein.In the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frog egg extracts, Ep is thephosphatase Cdc25
Synthesis of X, modulated by the signal strength (S)
X is converted into R in an autocatalytic process, modulated by thephosphorylated form of the enzymatic protein (Ep)

Response element. In the mechanism of MPF oscillations in frog eggextracts, R is the unphosphorylated form of cyclin B-CDK1 or active MPF.
